questions.text: What is the name of the little girl on the plane who needs a heart transplant?
questions.explanation:
Lisa.

	Her name is revealed when the pilot gets a phone call from the Mayo Clinic.  The girl's full name is Lisa Davis.

questions.text: What is the name of the original pilot of the airplane?
questions.explanation:
Clarence.

	Victor was the navigator, and Roger was the co-pilot, but Clarence was the pilot.  All three ate the fish and got violently ill leaving Ted Striker to fly the plane.

questions.text: Where is the airplane scheduled to land?
questions.explanation:
Chicago.

	This bit of information is revealed when Ted buys his ticket.  Ted is only flying to talk with Elaine, but he ends up saving the passengers and crew.

questions.text: Does Ted order a seat in smoking or non-smoking?
questions.explanation:
Smoking.

	He orders smoking, but realizes that the ticket he is handed is also smoking.  He is seated next to a little old lady who commits suicide after listening to Ted talk about how he met Elaine.

questions.text: How old is Randy the flight attendant?
questions.explanation:
26.

	She mentions her age to Dr. Rumack, when she's worried about the plane crashing.  She also mentions she isn't married.

questions.text: What does the little kid, Joey, eat on the plane?
questions.explanation:
Steak.

	Joey orders the steak, but his parents both order fish.  Unfortunately, everyone who eats the fish gets sick.

questions.text: After the war, Elaine and Ted joined the Peace Corps.  What tribe did they introduce to American culture?
questions.explanation:
The Molombos.

	The Molombos had never seen Americans before Ted and Elaine arrived.  They introduced basketball, and Tupperware to the tribe.

questions.text: What happens to Rex Kramer's cigarette when he throws it out the window?
questions.explanation:
It explodes.

	This is one of the directors' favourite jokes in the whole movie.  This small gag was nearly cut out of the final edit, but was left in because of a request from David Zucker.

questions.text: Randy the flight attendant is married.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Randy begins to cry because she has nothing to help her feel safe on the flight and nothing to help her feel better about life.  Another passenger rubs the fact in by saying that at least she, unlike Randy, is married.

questions.text: Who is the actor who plays Dr. Rumack?
questions.explanation:
Leslie Nielsen.

	Leslie Nielsen also plays roles in other satirical movies such as "Scary Movie 3", "Wrongfully Accused", "Spy Hard", and the "Naked Gun Trilogy".
